title: 114_s848
content: The Act titled "Resolving Environmental and Grid Reliability Conflicts Act of 2015" makes amendments to the Federal Power Act. The amendment to Section 202(c) of the Federal Power Act authorizes actions during war or emergency situations, ensuring compliance with environmental laws by limiting electric energy generation to essential hours only. The amendment to Section 202(c) of the Federal Power Act allows for actions during emergencies to ensure compliance with environmental laws while minimizing adverse impacts. Compliance with orders issued under this subsection does not constitute a violation of other environmental laws. The amendment to Section 202(c) of the Federal Power Act allows for actions during emergencies to ensure compliance with environmental laws while minimizing adverse impacts. Orders issued under this subsection do not constitute a violation of other environmental laws and expire within 90 days unless renewed by the Commission. The amendment to Section 202(c) of the Federal Power Act allows for emergency actions to comply with environmental laws, consulting with relevant federal agencies to minimize adverse impacts. Orders issued under this subsection expire within 90 days unless renewed by the Commission. The Commission may exclude conditions from renewed or reissued orders if they hinder addressing the emergency, with explanations provided. Conditions submitted by federal agencies must be made public. Court actions can impact orders issued under this subsection. The subsection allows for orders to be stayed, modified, or set aside by a court, with actions taken to comply with the order remaining in effect. Additionally, municipalities engaged in electric energy transmission or sale are included in temporary connection or construction under the Federal Power Act.
